msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

div1.p: In the District County of Washington Territory and for the third Judicial District thereof holding terms at Seattle for the Counties of King and Kilsap
In the matter of the application of } Order of Court M.J. McDonough for Writ of Habeas Corpus

Now on this day the petition of M.J. McDonough for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and his discharge form imprisonment thereon, coming on for hearing and all the facts alleged in said petition being admitted by the Prsecuting Attorney of this Court. and after argument of counsel, the Cout being fully advised in the premises, And it appearing to the court that the said M.J. McDonough was, after trial had before G.A Hill. Justice of the Peace in and for Seattle District King County, Washington Territory, adjudged guilty of the crime of being in contempt of Court, by said M.J. McDonough to such imprisonment and that he is now imprisoned in said Jail by and is in the custody of John H. McGraw Sheriff of said King County in pursuance to said Judgement and commitment. And is further appearing to the Court that said surface further as such in requirement is concerned judgement and commitment there// is mid and the said imprisonment illegal. It is now ordered that the said M.J McDonough be forthwith discharged from custody. and that he have and recover his costs and dispersments in this proceeding of and against the said John H. McGraw, respondant herein and that Execution issue therefor
5197 In the Dist. Court of Wash Ter holding terms at Seattle
Territory of Washington Plaintiff. vs M.J. McDonough Defendant.
Order of Court in the matter of application of Deft. for Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED FEB 23 1887 James Seavey, Clerk. By James Ludlow Deputy Clerk A.A. Newlin
